values: there is nothing i want more than to leave the country and live in a cramped apartment in northern ireland and work at my cousin's bed and breakfast. just start completely over. i just want to meet people, hear their story. i want to be wreckless and enjoy my life. i dont want to just go through the motions. college is just something to give me material for my first novel. i'm here for the experience, the education is a layover. a fall back if my writing career doesnt go as planned. i want to do things right, or wrong, whichever is more fun.

yes.
we are young and wreckless.
but nights like these make me glad that its still acceptable for us to feel indestructible.
untouchable.
driving back to richmond at 3 oclock in the morning.
after games of beer pong.
lame frat parties.
stealing expensive liquor from the person you introduce as the one who ruined your life.
who will never know it was you.
after asking our future senators, doctors, and lawyers if they knew where we could get some weed.
cops. ambulances. sirens. 
hiding.
cracked skulls and smoking roaches in a laundry room.
city kids just glad they were able to see the stars for a night.
no street lamps, only identifying each other by the embers of our cigarettes.
driving down 95 at exactly seventy.
we're close when the city lights start to drown out the stars.
and tonight.
strung out an all different things.
each person on their drug of choice.
driving aimlessly around a city we complain is closing in on us.
suffocating us.
but on nights like these.
no one seems to notice.

what i wrote on my last cc trip:

i feel that, even in their simplest forms, words are more-or- less ostentatious[though rightfully so]. the sheer meaning of the word just illustrates the futile struggle between the word and its meaning. the subject and the objectification of verbs, hyperboles and other such tawdry presumptions. emotions expressed through colors, shapes and [god forbid] sounds seem far too...easy. there are wheels turning but the results are inevitably bound to leave something to be desired. writing is an outlet for those of us not blessed with "artistic" ability. the artist's ability to replicate a rose on paper. to paint a mural. to photograph an object and pass it off as something you created. capturing a moment in time and making it your own. its theft. writing takes a level of [most of the time uncomfortable/horrifying] introspection. the beauty of writing is it's intricacy. a photo, a portrait, a song- you can take all of them for face value. but you'll never know the difference between a tragedy and comedy until the last line.

i thought it'd be easy.
i'd sit across the table from him and tell him exactly why i haven't spoken to him in two weeks.
just for the record, he had noticed.
and he pryed.
i've never responded well to prying.
i drank three cups of coffee as we talked in circles.
i told him i loved our banter.
our avoid-any-mention-of-anything-thats-bothered-either-of-us banter.
i meant exactly the opposite.
i copped out. as per usual.
but he reads me like a book.
i dont know where it came from but finally i told him.
he's been different since that night.
that night things almost went to far.
almost.
he said it was just a thing.  
he didn't want it to change anything between us.
a thing doesn't happen every day for a month.
i told him, i guess i wanted to give myself some space then.
he said ok.
just 
ok.
forget i said anything. i said. please, just do me a favor and forget about it.
relax. 
all is well.
thats all he had to say.

i crush up a valium to offset the speed. i use my school i.d. to scrape the valium, in its new form, onto a piece of toilet paper. i wrap the powder up in a tiny piece of the toilet paper, winch, and swallow. the valium will begin to work as soon as the toilet paper dissolves, presumably halfway down my throat. i haven't slept in almost 72 hours but jesus do i feel productive. i've entered the stage where everything slows down, but your mind, your mind is still fucking racing. slow down, you tell yourself. but your body isn't taking any requests.

"remember when i said i had you figured out?"
i told him i did. 
"yea, well i was wrong."
i turned to face him and all i could see was the ember of his cigarette. i bit his arm.
"do that again and i'll kiss you"
i'm not one to be told what to do.
i told him i was going to write a book about him one day.
he put his lips against mine and asked what i was going to write about.
i told him it was going to be a book about him and richmond.
"and what else?"
his lips still against mine i told him it was going to be about coffee and cary street.
he kissed my top lip and i kept talking. he bit my bottom lip and i rolled over. 
he put his hand between my knees and i hated myself a little bit.

<lj-cut text="dc sleeps alone tonight">
he hugged me like he hadnt seen be for years. he told me that i smelled amazing even though i'd just put out a cigarette. for the first twenty minutes it felt like the first time i went home to see him. i was all shakey and talking too much and i couldn't stop grinning. its strange to feel so at home with someone you've only known for a month. that lives an hour away from you. in your old home. 
its strange to know what you're missing. its even stranger to not mind.
we took the escalator up to the smithsonian and i turned around to find him staring at me. he asked if he could take a picture of me, because i was absolutely beautiful. i cant tell you how long i've waited for someone to call me beautiful. 
we went to get sushi and he ordered a few beers. as he loosened up he asked the question we'd both been afraid to ask. what did i think things would be like if i still lived in northern virginia. our answers had slight variations and i already missed him sitting right across from me. i dont usually let myself do this. its unrealistic. we both know it. but i cant remember the last time someone made me smile like i do when i'm around him. 
he put his hands on my face and kissed me on the corner of constitution and 17th st. somehow he saw the light change and grabbed me by the hand, only to kiss me harder on the other side. 
we fell asleep on the metro on the way home. the only two times i've ever had to say goodbye to him it was rushed. i hadn't prepared myself for how hard it would be to say goodbye when i had nowhere to be. he pushed me against my car 
and lips and teeth replaced words and i was thankful for that. he told me to get into my car and exit music for a film was playing. by the time i came up for air long enough to tell him i had to go subterranean homesick alien was on. it took until exit music came on again to convince him to leave. to convince myself to drive away.

You. 
You were a friend. 
You were a friend of mine 
I let you spend the night
You see how it was my fault. 
Of course it was mine.
I'm too hard at work. 
Have you ever heard of anything so absurd 
ever in your life.
I'm sorry for wasting your time.
Who am I to say this situation isn't great? 
It's my job to make the most of it
Of course I didn't know that it would happen to me. 
Not that easy.

i cant even remember the last time someone asked me how i was doing.
or shown a general interest in whats going on in my life.
all im hearing is who's being fucked over by who.
and i listen because i care.
but for once
just once
itd be nice to know that someone genuinely wants to know how i am.
sincerity is severly underrated.

i went home this weekend.
things just kind of worked out.
he knew it was for him.
i've never been that kind of girl.
but he didnt stop smiling the whole first night i saw him.
i'm beginning to understand how i could become that kind of girl.
he stood in the doorframe of my bathroom watching me fix my hair.
he looked at me the way no one has ever looked at me before.
he smiled and i asked him why.
he said i was just so pretty. 
that he wishes he could take a picture of me at that moment.
when my eyeliner was running and my hair was out of control from the rain.
i made him a vegan dinner because he asked me too.
we woke up at exactly the same moment 4 times last night.
each time it would hit me like a pile of bricks that i was in his arms.
he'd pull me closer and ask if i was alright.
alright would have been an understatement.
he had work in two hours but he didnt get mad when i woke him up because he was snoring.
i was his exception.
he asked if i was ok with it. 
i was.
i am.
i'm just trying to take this one step at a time.
waking up next to him this morning was unreal.
fumbling for my shirt as the sunrose. 
i can't even understand how this all happened.
now.
of all times.
im supposed to be above this whole falling for a guy in two weeks thing.
right?

everytime. she's out of town. she's busy. its never you want to talk or you miss me. its convenient and i'm familiar. you dont have anyone else. i'm your fallback. always. but not this time. i'm not going to let you continue to hurt me like this. you're not going to walk back into my life just to make me feel like this again. i'm not as weak as i used to be.

two days left and shes walking, one foot in front of the other. the road unfurling behind her, each step counteracts the one before it. its 32 degrees and her hands shake, as uncertain limbs are apt to do. she rubs her hands together and thinks back to a time where their lips never touched. hindsight makes skin softer, smells sweeter and longing more tangible. 


thats the great thing about the past. you can remember it however you want.

i lit a cigarette and broke the first resolution i should've made this year. then again, i've never been one to make resolutions. 

let it happen.

i made the mistake of asking my magic-8 ball if he would call today. "no" "doubt it" and "outlook not so good". great, an inanimate object has become as jaded as i have. i rephrase the question a thousand times but the preplanned phrases aren't humoring me today. i consider throwing it out the window but im

i woke up this morning apologizing to my liver. i tried to recall the prior night's events as my heart beat out of my chest. unfortunately i remembered a bit more than i had intended. immediately i claimed temporary amnesia, asking what had happened the night before and acting surprised by my actions, my heart beating faster and faster. i remembered "fuck yous" and rambling apologies from the night before but i listened as they told me nicer versions of how they'd responded to my inhabited state. its amazing what people will try to tell you when they think you don't remember. 
so i lied and claimed no responsibility for my actions. eventually i cracked (but maintained my status as an amnesiac) and she still "won't ever trust me again". and i'll never drink again. i'm hoping since i know one of those statements is a lie, the other one will follow suit. the killer here is that if she wasn't hurt by what i'd done, i'd have no regrets. when will i learn?

certain words strike a chord. you're not sure why but they always have and they always will. 

sitting in his car today there was something missing. i began to tell myself it was over and that it'd never be the same. i've tried to prepare myself before but this time i think it might be it. talking about the future i realized that he wasn't part of it, like he was before. i can imagine my life without him now. and the fact that i couldn't imagine my life without him before is what kept me from loving him. if i had known this would have happened either way maybe things would be different. maybe right now i'd be with him and i'd be happier than i've ever been in my life. things were going to change either way. things were said that can never be taken back. so whats stopping me from being happy? 

you have no choice but to surrender easily.

we'll always have you can't take it with you...

this kid has changed my life in so many ways.
in 15 minutes he's convinced me that i'm exactly where i should be.
doing exactly what i should be doing.
living life like it should be lived.
and he can do this all from hundreds of miles away.
sometimes i regret not letting myself fall in love with him.
but i know he deserves so much more.
more than i could ever give him.
i hope he will find that some day.
i want him to be happy.
i want him to have everything he could ever want.
even if that doesn't include me.
specifically if it doesn't include me.

"maybe theres a reason they make movies about this" he says, pulling me closer to his chest. he makes some offhand comment about how perfectly i fit into his arms and i hate every word that comes out of his mouth. and i hate how goddamn close we are. so i'll stand to close to a tree during a storm and let the static rain cling to my skin. they say lightening doesn't strike twice but then again, i've always been a fucking exception.

will you feel alive at the end of this?
i was driving back to work and on a whim i lit a cigarette and drove by one of my (many) old schools. i looked at it and felt nothing. not a thing. nothing feels like home and nothing gives me nostalgia anymore. i barely remember the place. 
sometimes i'm convinced im completely alone, and that i always will be. but i think im ok with that. 
does that make me crazy?
but at the same time, recently, i havent been able to be by myself. i always have to be on the phone with someone or on my way to meet someone.
i just feel like no one is up to speed with me. i just want to be on the same page as me. someone. anyone. just going the same pace. not asking questions just content to be ok with how things are. i need someone to hold me so i dont have to be alone with my thoughts for once.

this is not my miracle.
nine days and nine nights and nothing that even somewhat resembles a miracle.
what a waste of time faith is.
but this saturday everything is going to change. i can feel it.
sometimes i think i need him so badly. and im so afraid and excited about what will happen when we go away alone. i know no matter what it will be wrong. someone is going to get hurt and someone is going to regret. and i love that inevitablity. i love it.
things are changing and slowly shifting into place. meanwhile im going crazy and i love being this completely different person. it was about time i reinvented myself. even if i didnt mean to. or want to for that matter.
its an intriguing thing, going crazy. people are worrying but why worry? i think my biological clock is just ticking and i've overstayed my three years. i need new people. a new life. new adventures. getting drunk and kissing people i know i shouldnt kiss is simply not going to cut it for much longer.
i need to get out of here. but i'll be as destructive as i can in my remaining days.
365.

i want to love. 
i need to love.
i need to know what it feels like. just for once.
i dont know whats going on with him. i suppose i should find out. i think i'd be ok either way but i just need to know.
so i can break it off now if i need too.
i really would be ok with it. it would be one of those "fun while it lasted" things....like the past year.
i dont mind it just need some fucking consistencey in my life. its been so long. 
and i miss him. i hate that hes barely speaking to me.
i miss him so much.
i wish every night could be like last night. 
when you can relax outside with a drink in one hand and a cigarette in the other, chain smoking your problems away. and the only thing you worry about is how much vodka is left. everything you say makes sense at the time. you're not sure if its because you're drunk or for once it actually coming together. you want so badly for him to hold you and say baby its gonna be ok. we're perfect for each other. and you love when he calls you baby. but you're not sure who you want to say it to. but it doesnt bother you because you're with people you love drinking and smoking and its summer and you have no worries. and everynight should be like that. you feel more at home than you have in forever and its just right. and its been so long since somethign just felt right.
consistency like that which i have craved
is that people change so unexpectedly.

i just finished my homemade iced coffee and its left me freezing and jittery. caffeine usually doesnt affect me but things change.
im not used to feeling like this. im not anxious about the situation for once. im happy. just happy and taking things as they come. happy and not rushing, not worrying too much. indifferent i suppose, but in the good way. its been a long time since i met someone who just made me happy. someone who i just think about and smile.  and its so strange and unexpected and refreshing. and im not sure if he's the matt of this summer or if its something more...but im not going to worry about that right now. because this is exactly how i want to feel. im just myself around him.

i've gotten to thinking about my friends leaving this month. its so strange to me... im strangely unaffected by them leaving. of  course ill miss them but i was expecting to be really sad. but when i think about it im so used to getting close to people and never seeing them again. but thats what makes life interesting.

i really need to keep this mindframe up. this is my last year of highschool. i need to make an impression. i need to be a whole new person. im not going to care about petty shit anymore. im just going to be happy and talk to everyone and try not to be negative. because this is it. after this i can finally begin to really live. and i cant wait.

you have no idea how exhausting it was being so in love with you. no idea whatsoever. while you feed me these lines about how you barely know her and i'm perfect. no matter how many girls you're with, you always wish they were me.
i believe every word that you say.
i'm just tired.
now he comes along. everything i want. he's right there and attainable but so unrealistic. disinterest grows each time i conquer him but i want him to want me more. 
i knew he wouldnt call. i was ok with that. even as the words left my lips there was no doubt in my mind that he wouldn't call. we talked and im back in this hole where i have to see him again and try to convince him he wants me more than i want him.
i'm sick of playing these games with myself.
for some reason i believe he'll call today. i'm not sure why. 
the light stayed green and yellow when his band came on. i'm a firm believer in karma and its about time things start going right for me. i've been a good person lately, i've relentlessly taken care of my friends. so its my turn now.
right?
i guess we'll see.

im so sick of this not in my chest. 
its like this nagging reminder that im not doing all that i can to make myself happy. 
so starting today....starting today.

i'm past the point of being able to explain how much this hurts. and im sick of writing in 3rd person because i can never admit how i feel. how holding on to you tonight was the most satisfying thing to happen to me in a really long time. and how weak i feel for that. i know you're trying to ruin this for me. if this exists, i need it more than i can say. dont fuck it up this time.
last night was one of those nights where you just can't bare to be alone. you need cigarettes like you need oxygen. you surround your self with people who will only make things worse.

you usher your friends (not even close ones) to their cars under your umbrella because you can't stand to see their pretty dresses get wet. in the process your feet are soaked to the bone and your hair (that you spent so much time on) is a frizzy mess. the last one gets to her car (rejecting your door to door umbrella service) and you can sink into your seat, soaked to the bone and still shaking. you rapidly recollect your evening and words blur together just like they did at the time when you told them you couldnt understand what you were saying. and your hands are still shaking like they were when they promised you'd feel better after you ate. you appreciate the gesture, none the less. and so you drive with the hail pelting your car, the piece you placed on your tongue having long since melted. and a million thoughts rush your head so you call a close friend and leave a long winded message on her phone. hoping she'll decipher it, just needing someone to talk at. you find yourself shocked that you were relieved that she didnt answer. and you wonder if maybe you're going a little crazy. the storm is clearing up now and the green lights look blue against the grey sky and you wonder where exactly you're going. and you feel the need to stop at the nursing home you spent so much time at and comfort the people you felt so connected to for the month you volunteered there. if they're still there. you hope they're still there and they arent confused or afraid of the storm. because right now you're confused and afraid, but not because of the storm. and your hands are still shaking and you wish it was the storm causing your anxiety but its not but for now you can pretend it is. now you're convinced that you're dying so you stop at a friends house for a cigarette to speed along the process. he's not there. but the road is still there and the lights are still blue against the grey sky and you're still shaking. fucking in rhythm and sorror echos in your ears because you cant stand the silence. and the lights are still blue and you still wonder where you're going. you hit the final stretch and the clouds are rushing to the east (because you assume the opposite of what makes sense) and you see lightening almost strike a tree not even 20 feet from you. and you're disappointed that the tree isnt on fire. you let go of the wheel and your car veers to the left like it always does when you forget to refill your tire with air. you wonder if it would veer enough to the left to run into the tree that didnt get struck by lightening. and if it had caught fire, and you'd have hit the tree, if anyone would believe the coincidental double tragedy. you wonder if people would be more perplexed as to how the tree caught fire or how your car caught fire. was it the lightening or the exploding engine? you breath faster and you're home. home is relative and you're sick of thinking. sick of being wet, sick of shaking, and sick of thinking. and you still dont have a cigarette.

its been awhile since i've been able to feel anything. love. hate. rejection. sorrow. you name it, i havent been able to feel it for about a year, now. i can trace it back to the date. now, of all times, i can feel. i shouldn't feel like this. not about you anyhow. its different now. it started as something i controlled. no one has been able to get to me the way you have. you cant leave. not now. no one has ever gotten me the way you do. and now i know that there was a reason i wouldnt let people get me. my whole life i've moved around. i got used to saying goodbye and not caring. you forced me to care. and now you're the one leaving. i cant really imagine my life right now without you. i know we have two seperate worlds but i cant imagine what its going to be like not having you to come to. none of this is meant in a creepy obsessive way. its not like that at all. its just that no one has been able to get through to me for a really long time. and you got through to me. you made me feel like what i have to say matters. you made me feel like what im passionate about is worth while. you made me feel like i was worth something. thank you for that. thank you for making me feel again. i know we'll (distantly) keep in touch. it kills me more than you realize. im hoping, right now, for the 1% chance that we'll keep in close touch. i know what you're doing will make you happy. and you're going to be amazing at it, theres no doubt in my mind. i just dont want to lose you. i've never talked like this about anyone in my life. im swallowing my pride right now as i admit this all to myself. i guess all i can say right now is thank you. thank you.

i hate that i've gone from feeling everything times ten than i should to not feeling anything at all.
a happy medium just doesnt exist.
i dont care about anything or anyone anymore.
i cant even force myself to care.
its getting really fucking old.

i never realized how much i loved you until tonight.
the same thing that more or less tore us apart ended.
and i know how much it hurts you.
and i've never wanted anything more than i wanted you to have him back tonight.
a year ago, i would have been glad this happened. 
but its killing me to see you this upset.
you and i, we've both grown alot. we're both a little less selfish now. 
i hate seeing you sad and being able to make you smile tonight made me realize that not all is lost. 
no matter how distant i feel from you, we'll always have that connection.
ever get the feeling that you've subconciously made the conscious decision to ruin everything that could possibly be good in your life?

today is one of those days when you just have the feeling in the pit of your stomach that tells you something isnt right.
and no matter what you do, you can't make yourself feel anything other than nothing. 
part of me wishes i could take back what happened last night. it was fun while it lasted, but it just left me wishing for the real thing.
i'm sick of feeling lonely. last night i felt like someone wanted me for the first time in a long time.
i knew i was being used and i was, and still am, ok with that. because i used him too.
the worst part is i know i'd do it again. and i will do it again, if given the oppurtunity. 
i just wish i knew what i wanted.
i'm sick of feeling things 100x's more than other people.

i cant stop thinking about him.
and its so wrong.

this is the weather that starts revolutions and inspires revalations and causes you to count off by twos and fours in your head. when the days seem long and pass by uniformly. the week goes by and any hope of change slips through your fingers. but nights like this cant go by unnoticed.

i'm two different people.
i'm mysterious, i'm cold-hearted, i'm deceitful, i'm analytical, i'm selfish, i'm picky, i'm selfish, i'm intimidating.
but then 
i'm loud, i'm funny, i'm charming, i'm out-spoken, i'm carefree, i'm the center of attention.
the thing is, neither one is a facade.
its who i am, both of them.
i dont know which i hate more, both sides of me, or the fact that i have to completely different personalities.
i dont even know anymore.

Dear President Bush, For the past 3 years or so, you have been using the war on terror as your political crutch. Yet you've found no substantial evidence of another country having weapons of mass destruction. On September 11 you and your adminstration made the assumption that Afghanistan was the country responsible for the terrorist attacks. For the sake of the arguement, i'll believe that you had reason to believe that. After you successfully got the American public to believe that we were waging a way on Afghanistan, you slowly moved the "terrorist" lable over to Iraq. Did the American public ever once question whether or not Iraq had anything to do with the attacks? No. Because you, Mr. Bush, are very good at covering your ass. You got American in such an uproar about those attacks that they were willing to call anyone a terrorist. Now, I am in no way, shape, or form trying to take away from the tragedy of September 11th, but you used America's sense of fear to make them believe that invading Iraq had to do with our sense of security. You, Mr. Bush, are the terrorist. You have come to equate the word war with patriotism and i'm sorry sir, but that just is not how things should be. As I recall, President Bush, you once promised to generate more jobs for the unemployeed. Statistics show that during your presidency, 3 million men and women have lost their jobs. In December, 1 thousand jobs were generate. Congratulations, Mr. Bush, you are certainly doing a fantastic job. I also have a vague recollection of your pride when you said that our economy is doing fantastic. Well, Mr. Bush, I certainly consider a $500 billion dollar deficit quit an accomplishment. Oh, but you don't have to worry about it, because it will be my children paying it off. I also have to hand it to you, sir. You really are doing a fantastic job with supporting the troops you send over to fight your war. Yes sir, it is your war. These men are giving them selves up for your cause, they arent asking questions. How do you repay them? Why, you cut their pay! Oh, and then when they try to go home to visit their families, you lef them cover the cause. You sure are considerate President Bush. Now i could go on for hours with these questions i have for you, sir, but I'll conclude with the idea that irks me the most about your speech last night. Marriage is about love. Marriage is about caring so much about someone you cant live without them. Marriage is not about race. Marriage is not about religion. Marriage is not about political affiliation. Marriage is not about sexual orientation. Every year there are millions of men who beat their wives, there are divorces, and there is adultery. We let all of these people get married because its "normal." Mr. President, I'm sorry but I have a difficult time believing that you would stop the marriage of two people who truly love each other. That you would prevent two humans from being completely happy together. That you would do this based on an outdated law from Leviticus. I've been in catholic school all of my life, Sir, so I'd like to think i know the Bible pretty well by now. Leviticus also states that a woman is unclean for seven days while on her period, and seven days following her period, and to become clean, she must sacrafice two birds. I'm sorry sir, but how many women do you know do this? Leviticus also states that you can not trim the hair on the side of your head or the edges of your beard. I cannot help but notice, Mr. Bush, that you have short hair and no beard. Interesting how we can pick and choose what we can believe from Leviticus and what is complete nonsense. Thats what trying to ban gay marriage is. Nonsense. God Bless American.

when i was babysitting i had one of those moments where you forget where you are. i wouldn't call it deja vu. it was like when a certain smell or taste reminds you of a really specific moment. or when you wake up and halfway through the morning something will happen to remind you of part of the dream you had the night before. you cant put a finger on what made you think of it, and even the part of the dream you recollect for that moment is fleeting. 
i was playing hide and seek with the kids i was babysitting for. i hid in one of the bedrooms and the windows were opened a little bit. and just the amount of light coming through the windows along with the freezing breeze just made me remember my childhood like i cant even describe. just walking down the street with my brother + danny and playing until it got dark and we had to come in. dark always came too soon when you were little. drinking the rest of my grandmother's bailey's irish cream because she always insisted it tasted like candy. running out the front door and sitting on my front porch trying to catch my breath after seeing my father cry for the first time. understanding what the word cancer meant. sitting in my new brother's room next to his crib and listening to him breath. we'd just taken him off the heart monitor and i couldnt bare it if my mom lost another baby. getting my first fat lip in a game of backyard baseball. running around my cousin's house with ghostbuster packs on our backs. wondering why my body didnt look like the girls in playboy. watching my grandfather play banjo at my aunt's high school graduation party in my backyard and being so proud of him. going to my aunt's plays and being so excited when she came from back stage and gave me the first hug. sitting on the edge of my bathtub with the door closed and letting the vapors try to clear my chest when i had bronchitus. walking to laurie and johns and running barefoot around my neighborhood. cutting through backyards much to the dismay of my topless sunbathing neighbor. venturing through the woods to "our spot" and trying to start a protest when they starting building houses there. my aspirations were always far ahead of my time. taking pictures in my front yard before my dance recitals. my dad telling me we couldnt go to the movies that day. watching my brother sob after they told him my grandfather died. i was older and he couldnt see me cry. saying "its ok michael" and running to my room, thrusting my greif stricken 9 year old body on the bed and sobbing. where they couldnt see me cry. eating pancakes that morning and ruining the taste of them forever. understanding why i couldnt ever see my grandfather again. swinging on the swings in my cousins back yard when he explained to me that cousins couldnt marry each other. someone had just told him about it, i never knew why he told me. getting infuriated when my neighbors would play on my swing set when i was eating dinner. the immense sense of pride i experienced when my father talked about me in my grandfather's eulogy. balling at the fact that i had barely known him. the last words i said to him. the taste of cheesecake never being the same. 
i just sat there on the edge of the bed for 15 minutes not even realizing where i was.
